is.erle.captain

Enum IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions>
      • is.erle.captain.IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions>
    Enclosing class:
    IsErleCaptainActivity

    static enum IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions
extends java.lang.Enum<IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions>
    This enum contains a list of possible commands to be sent to the mavlink activity. Use this command list to send commands to mavlink activity.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Abhay Kumar
    See Also:
    IsErleMavlinkActivity

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ARM
      Arms/Disarms the drone.
      AUTOPILOT_REBOOT
      Reboot the Autopilot system running on the drone.
      AUTOPILOT_SHUTDOWN
      Shutdown the Autopilot system running on the drone.
      BOOTLOADER_REBOOT
      Do Bootloader reboot of the drone.
      CLEAR_MISSION
      Clears Mission file on the drone.
      GET_LOG_ENTRY
      Get all the Log Entries stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone.

      Get Mission data stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone.
      GET_PARAMETER
      Get parameter data for a single parameter stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone.

      Request heartbeat message from mavlink activity.

      Requests the drone to send back the requested data streams like sensors, navigation etc.

      Read all the Log Entries from the drone.
      READ_MISSION
      Read Mission file from the drone.
      READ_PARAMETER_LIST_START
      Read all the parameter data from the drone.
      SEND_COMMAND
      Send a Command to the drone from MAV_CMD class.
      SET_ALLOWED_AREA
      Set the allowed area of the drone.
      SET_CURRENT_ACTIVE_WP
      Set current active waypoint on the drone from the mission file.
      SET_GPS_ORIGIN
      Set the GPS Origin of the drone.

      Set the mode of the drone as auto, guided, stabilize etc.

      Reboot the system of the drone.
      SYSTEM_SHUTDOWN
      Shutdown the system of the drone.
      UPDATE_TARGET
      Update the default target system and target component.
      WRITE_MISSION
      Write Mission file on the drone.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • HEARTBEAT

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions HEARTBEAT
        Request heartbeat message from mavlink activity. Can not have any function arguments.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.heartbeat

      • READ_MISSION

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions READ_MISSION
        Read Mission file from the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.readMissionListStart(byte, byte)

      • GET_MISSION

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions GET_MISSION
        Get Mission data stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone. Can not have any other arguments.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.readWaypointList

      • WRITE_MISSION

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions WRITE_MISSION
        Write Mission file on the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.sendMissionListStart(byte, byte)

      • SET_CURRENT_ACTIVE_WP

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SET_CURRENT_ACTIVE_WP
        Set current active waypoint on the drone from the mission file. Can have 3 arguments as current sequence, target system and target component in order. If 1 argument is given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity with the current sequence as argument.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.setCurrentActiveWP(short,byte, byte)

      • CLEAR_MISSION

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions CLEAR_MISSION
        Clears Mission file on the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.clearMissionList(byte, byte)

      • ARM

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions ARM
        Arms/Disarms the drone. Can have 0,1,2,3 arguments as switch on/off, target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent arm the default drone of the mavlink activity. To disarm send 1 argument as arm on/off value and the command will be performed on the default drone. If 2 arguments are there, the drone with target system and target component will be armed. If 3 arguments are there, the drone with target system and target component will be armed/disarmed.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doARM(boolean, byte, byte)

      • READ_PARAMETER_LIST_START

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions READ_PARAMETER_LIST_START
        Read all the parameter data from the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.readParameterListStart(byte, byte)

      • GET_PARAMETER_LIST

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions GET_PARAMETER_LIST
        Get parameter data map stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone. Can not have any other arguments.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.paramList

      • GET_PARAMETER

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions GET_PARAMETER
        Get parameter data for a single parameter stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone. It will have one more argument in the form of parameter string id.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.paramList

      • SET_PARAMETER

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SET_PARAMETER
        Sets the supplied parameter value on the drone. Can have 2 or 4 arguments as parameter Id, parameter value, target system and target component in order. If 2 arguments are given, then the command will be sent to set the parameter value with the given parameter Id to the default drone of the mavlink activity. If 4 arguments are there, the parameter will be written on the drone with target system and target component.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.setParam(String,float,byte, byte)

      • AUTOPILOT_REBOOT

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions AUTOPILOT_REBOOT
        Reboot the Autopilot system running on the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doRebootAutopilot(byte, byte)

      • AUTOPILOT_SHUTDOWN

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions AUTOPILOT_SHUTDOWN
        Shutdown the Autopilot system running on the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doShutdownAutopilot(byte, byte)

      • BOOTLOADER_REBOOT

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions BOOTLOADER_REBOOT
        Do Bootloader reboot of the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doBootloaderReboot(byte, byte)

      • SYSTEM_SHUTDOWN

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SYSTEM_SHUTDOWN
        Shutdown the system of the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doSystemShutdown(byte, byte)

      • SYSTEM_REBOOT

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SYSTEM_REBOOT
        Reboot the system of the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doSystemReboot(byte, byte)

      • SET_MODE

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SET_MODE
        Set the mode of the drone as auto, guided, stabilize etc. Can have 1 or 2 arguments as mode and target system in order. If 1 argument is given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity to switch to the given mode. Otherwise it will be sent to the target system specified.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.setMode(String, byte)

      • SET_ALLOWED_AREA

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SET_ALLOWED_AREA
        Set the allowed area of the drone. Can have 7 or 9 arguments as Point3D 1, Point3D 2,coordinate frame, target system and target component in order. If 7 arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity to set the allowed area with the given coordinate frame. Otherwise it will be sent to the target system and target component specified.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.setAllowedArea(Point3D, Point3D, byte, byte, byte), Point3D

      • SET_GPS_ORIGIN

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SET_GPS_ORIGIN
        Set the GPS Origin of the drone. Can have 3 or 5 arguments as Point3D gps origin , target system and target component in order. If 3 arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity to switch to set the GPS Origin with the given coordinate frame. Otherwise it will be sent to the target system and target component specified.
        See Also:
        is.erle.mavlink.IsErleMavlinkActivity#setAllowedArea(Point3D, byte, byte), Point3D

      • READ_LOG_ENTRY

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions READ_LOG_ENTRY
        Read all the Log Entries from the drone. Can have 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If no arguments are given, then the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.getLogList(byte, byte)

      • GET_LOG_ENTRY

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions GET_LOG_ENTRY
        Get all the Log Entries stored in mavlink activity after receiving from drone. Can not have any other arguments.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.logEntry

      • SEND_COMMAND

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions SEND_COMMAND
        Send a Command to the drone from MAV_CMD class. It can have 8 or 10 arguments as Command, param1, param2, param3, param4, param5, param6, param7, target system, target component. If arguments are there, the command will be sent to the default drone of the mavlink activity otherwise it will be sent to the target system and target component.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.doCommand(short, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, byte, byte)

      • READ_DATASTREAM

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions READ_DATASTREAM
        Requests the drone to send back the requested data streams like sensors, navigation etc. Can have 2,4 or 5 arguments as stream id, rate, start/stop, target system and target component. If 2 arguments are given, it is considered as stream id and rate respectively, if 4 are given, then it is considered as stream id, rate, target system and target component and if 5 arguments are given, it is considered as stream id, rate, start/stop, target system and target component.
        See Also:
        IsErleMavlinkActivity.getDataStream(int, int, byte, byte)

      • UPDATE_TARGET

        public static final IsErleCaptainActivity.CommandOptions UPDATE_TARGET
        Update the default target system and target component. Can have 1 or 2 arguments as target system and target component in order. If 1 argument is given, then the default target system of the mavlink activity will be set. Otherwise both target system and target component will be set.
